title: Gazebo Splashscreen up forever if plugin blocks during WorldUpdateBegin

content.raw:
The gazebo GUI splash screen never goes away if a plugin blocks WorldUpdateBegin. This is used to synchronize gazebo with another tool. The plugin blocks until it receives a signal from the other tool that it is ready for the next timestep.

I've attached a model plugin and world that reproduces the behavior.

* Use `cmake`
* run `make`
* from the build directory `GAZEBO_PLUGIN_PATH=$(pwd) gazebo --verbose path/to/src/synchronized_model.world`

There are workarounds to this issue

* If the plugin allows the world to step once, the splash screen will go away. With the attached plugin type "asdf[enter]" to step the world once, and the splash screen will disappear
* If the world is started paused `--pause` the splash screen will go away
